description: The `synthetic.audit_trail` table appears intended to record changes or events within the database, as suggested by its name, despite currently having no rows or visible column names to confirm its exact structure or function. It serves a standalone role with no immediate relational ties to other tables within the database, as it neither references nor is referenced by any other tables. As it lacks both sample data and descriptive metadata, further detail on its specific utility within the data model cannot be discerned.

columns.name: audit_id
columns.description: A sequential identifier for individual records in the audit trail, ensuring each record has a unique reference number. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: changed_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when an entry in the audit trail was modified. It reflects the last change timestamp for audit records.

columns.name: ip_address
columns.description: The column captures the IP address related to entries in the audit trail, possibly indicating the originating source of a transaction or user action. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a specific action or change was made in the audit trail. Its purpose is unclear from available data.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Represents the date and time when an audit record was last updated. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX audit_trail_pkey ON synthetic.audit_trail USING btree (audit_id)
